comment: This professor was super sweet! He's rambles a lot and if history isn't your thing, you'll be lost. However, tests are EASY. Study your guide and you'll make a 100. He's also really flexible.

He's adorable and funny. He tells tons of stories from the past about teaching. I looked forward to his class. The lectures ran long but his class was enjoyable. I would take him for every education class if I could. He's there for you and will help you as much as he can. Will let you redo work if you didn't do it right the first time. Easy & fun.

Hes a great person in and out but I took him for a Hybrid class and he made me not love the material anymore. He is very un-organized and just talks the whole class from poorly made slides. If you ask for help he gives it but not very clearly, we have changed dates for assignments and pushed them back by a month. Lovely man but not my favorite

Professor was really nice, very personable and the class was super easy. I wish, actually, that it had been more hands on and less the professor talking tho'. If you are looking for an easy A, this is it, but you might be better to take another class to really get a good starting point for your education degree just so you learn a little more.

Good teacher. He is engaged and interested in everything he teaches so he is easy to follow. I took a hybrid class and as long as you go to class and contribute to the discussions you'll make an A. He is very friendly and open to helping students. He NEVER emails back though so make sure you get all questions out in class.

Easiest A I have made thus far in college. Hardly use book but you'll need it to help write your paper (which is so easy and I hate papers) and for the open book/open note final. He is crazy unorganized but a nice man. He hardly reads your discussion responses... in fact I am pretty sure he has never even read the questions.

I took this professor as a Hybrid class. As long as you do the assignments and participated in the Field Experience you should get an easy A. I used the textbook a lot in class, but you don't have to have the newest version to complete assignments.

He is a fairly nice Professor. He is approachable and "down to earth". Make sure you complete the field experience for the class, and do the online modules for it. I had him for a "hybrid"section of the class. He does recant a lot of his own experinces in the class, so he goes on tangents sometimes. We had a philosphy paper on education to write.

So far, I've only had one class with this professor but in that one class I can tell you that he's down-to-earth, personable, funny but without being arrogant.  The guy is the perfect example of what a teacher should be.  He's like a "regular" guy but I mean that as a complement, no doubt.
Great Professor. Relates real-world experience to class topics. He gives it to you straight, unlike other professors.

Dr. Nelson is a great guy, but the class material is terrible. As long as you put effort into the assignments he'll give you an 'A'. You are also allowed to use the book on tests so make sure you buy it.
Easy teacher, boring class, not clear on assignments. Easy A as long as you attempt the assignments.
He is just a great nice guy. The class is very easy. He gives you forever to turn stuff in. Make sure you do the field experience!

Mr. Nelson is precious. He is an excellent example of a truly loving teacher, husband, and father. He is the most genuinely caring and understanding teacher I have ever had in my life. Don't take him if you just want an easy A out of the class; he deserves more respect than that.

Nice guy, very helpful. He is a former high school professor/principal. He likes to talk a lot, sometimes kind of boring but I enjoyed most of it. Too much time on the book, I would have rather had class discussions. You could turn in all your work at the very end and still make an A.
